Authors:
Raihana Ridzuan, Siti Izera Ismail, Mohd Rafii Yusop,
Martini Mohammad Yusoff, Gous Miah, Usman Magaji
Title:
Colletotrichum species complex associated with anthracnose
disease on Capsicum annuum in Malaysia
Abstract:
Anthracnose is one of the most devastating fungal disease,
caused by Colletotrichum species complex (Ascomycota) and affecting the
quality and yield production of chili. Colletotrichum truncatum is the
most common and usual causal agent of chili anthracnose. In this study,
anthracnose-infected fruits were collected from two states in Malaysia
(Selangor and Perak) and the isolates obtained were subjected to
microinjection method to validate KochÂ’s postulates. Disease assessment
for anthracnose was evaluated after 10 days of inoculation and five
potential isolates with anthracnose lesion greater than 15% were
selected to further molecular confirmation using PCR protocol. The
phylogenetic analyses from DNA sequence data based on the internal
transcribed spacer (ITS) regions clearly identified the pathogenic
isolates as C. truncatum, C. sojae, and C. fructicola with bootstrap
support 100%, and 98% respectively. Among 13 chili genotypes tested, two
AVRDC improved lines, AVPP0514 and AVPP0805 showed resistant (<2%
anthracnose lesion) against all Colletotrichum species complex isolated
from this study.
